name: Taj Mahal, Agra
description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river.

name: Qutub Minar, Delhi
description: A minaret and 'victory tower' that forms part of the Qutb complex.

name: Red Fort, Delhi
lootedMessage: Looks like the treasure was 'fort-ified' a little too well. Nothing here!

name: Gateway of India, Mumbai
description: An arch-monument built in the early twentieth century in the city of Mumbai.

name: Hampi, Karnataka
lootedMessage: You found a single, solitary banana peel. A monkey probably beat you to it.

name: Khajuraho Group of Monuments
description: A group of Hindu temples and Jain temples in Chhatarpur district, Madhya Pradesh.

name: Konark Sun Temple
lootedMessage: The sun has baked this place dry. Not a single doubloon in sight.

name: Meenakshi Temple, Madurai
description: A historic Hindu temple located on the southern bank of the Vaigai River.

name: Sanchi Stupa
lootedMessage: A note reads: 'Went meditating, took the treasure with me for focus.' Bummer.

name: Golden Temple, Amritsar
description: The holiest Gurdwara and the most important pilgrimage site of Sikhism.

name: Mysore Palace
description: A historical palace and a royal residence at Mysore in the Indian state of Karnataka.

name: India Gate, Delhi
lootedMessage: Lots of tourists, but zero treasure. Someone must've snatched it.

name: Humayun's Tomb
description: The tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India.

name: Jaisalmer Fort
lootedMessage: It's a sandcastle! And just as empty. The treasure must be in another castle.

name: Jantar Mantar, Jaipur
description: A collection of nineteen architectural astronomical instruments.

name: Mehrangarh Fort, Jodhpur
description: One of the largest forts in India. Built in around 1459 by Rao Jodha.

name: Victoria Memorial, Kolkata
lootedMessage: The only gold here is on the ceiling. And you can't reach it.

name: Charminar, Hyderabad
description: A monument and mosque located in Hyderabad, Telangana, India.

name: Lotus Temple, Delhi
lootedMessage: Peaceful, quiet, and completely treasure-free. How serene.

name: Ranakpur Jain Temple
description: A renowned Jain temple at Ranakpur is dedicated to Tirthankara Rishabhanatha.

name: Dal Lake, Srinagar
lootedMessage: You searched all the houseboats. All you found was some delicious tea.

name: Wagah Border
description: A border crossing on the Radcliffe Line, which divides India and Pakistan.

name: Kanha National Park
lootedMessage: A majestic tiger stares at you. You decide the treasure isn't worth it.

name: Kaziranga National Park
description: A protected area in the northeast Indian state of Assam.

name: Periyar National Park
lootedMessage: An elephant trumpets nearby. You suddenly forget what you were looking for.

name: Ellora Caves
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site located in the Aurangabad district of Maharashtra.

name: Ajanta Caves
description: About 30 rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments which date from the 2nd century BCE.

name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
lootedMessage: So grand, so impressive, so... empty. Not a single coin.

name: Mahabalipuram
description: A town on a strip of land between the Bay of Bengal and the Great Salt Lake.

name: Varkala Beach
lootedMessage: You dug a lot of sandcastles, but found no treasure chests.

name: Rameshwaram Temple
description: A Hindu temple dedicated to the god Shiva on Rameswaram island.

name: Puri Jagannath Temple
lootedMessage: A huge crowd! Someone in the throng must have pocketed the loot.

name: Kedarnath Temple
description: A Hindu temple dedicated to the god Shiva. Located on the Garhwal Himalayan range.

name: Badrinath Temple
lootedMessage: The air is thin up here, and so is the treasure. All gone!

name: Tawang Monastery
description: The largest monastery in India and second largest in the world.

name: Sundarbans National Park
lootedMessage: You're pretty sure a crocodile is sitting on the chest. You're not going to argue.

name: Cellular Jail
description: A colonial prison in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India.

name: Baga Beach, Goa
lootedMessage: Too many parties, not enough treasure maps. The chest is empty.

name: Old Goa Churches
description: A complex of churches and convents, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Mount Abu
lootedMessage: Great views! But it seems another pirate enjoyed the view and took the gold.

name: Guruvayur Temple
description: A Hindu temple dedicated to the Lord Guruvayurappan.

name: Thanjavur
lootedMessage: Lots of art and history, but the treasure seems to be 'history' too.

name: Coorg
description: A hilly region in Karnataka state, southern India, known for its coffee plantations.

name: Ooty Lake
lootedMessage: You rented a paddleboat to search the lake. All you found was a lost oar.

name: Kullu Valley
description: A broad open valley in Himachal Pradesh, India, between Manali and Largi.

name: Shimla Ridge
lootedMessage: The only gold here is the 'Golden Jubilee' restaurant sign.

name: Darjeeling
description: A town in India's West Bengal state, in the Himalayan foothills.

name: Pench National Park
lootedMessage: A pack of wild dogs seems to be using the chest as a toy. You back away slowly.

name: Ranthambore National Park
description: A vast wildlife reserve near the town of Sawai Madhopur in Rajasthan.

name: Udaipur City Palace
lootedMessage: So luxurious, they probably spent all the treasure on renovations.

name: Chittorgarh Fort
description: One of the largest forts in India. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Pushkar Lake
lootedMessage: Holy water, yes. Holy treasure, no. Someone prayed it away.

name: Varanasi Ghats
description: Riverfront steps leading to the banks of the River Ganges.

name: Leh
lootedMessage: You're too breathless from the altitude to even lift a treasure chest.

name: Pangong Tso
description: An endorheic lake in the Himalayas situated at a height of about 4,350 m.

name: Rumtek Monastery, Sikkim
lootedMessage: A monk offers you enlightenment instead of gold. You politely decline.

name: Gangtok
description: The capital of the mountainous northern Indian state of Sikkim.

name: Tirupati Temple
lootedMessage: All the treasure has already been donated. Your timing is terrible.

name: Hawa Mahal, Jaipur
description: A palace in Jaipur, India. It is constructed of red and pink sandstone.

name: Akshardham, Delhi
lootedMessage: A note inside the empty chest says 'The real treasure is inner peace'.

name: Birla Mandir, Hyderabad
description: A Hindu temple, built on a 280 feet high hillock called Naubath Pahad.

name: Sula Vineyards
lootedMessage: No gold, but you found a fantastic bottle of Sauvignon Blanc. Fair trade?

name: Bhedaghat Marble Rocks
description: A town and a nagar panchayat in Jabalpur district in the state of Madhya Pradesh.

name: Pondicherry
lootedMessage: The French architecture is lovely, but it seems they took all the treasure back to France.

name: Chembra Peak
description: The highest peak in Wayanad, at 2,100 m above sea level.

name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
lootedMessage: The gods are guarding this place. You decide not to mess with them.

name: Ganga Aarti, Haridwar
description: A religious prayer that takes place at the banks of the River Ganges.

name: Vivekananda Rock Memorial
lootedMessage: Surrounded by water, but the chest is bone dry and empty.

name: Elephanta Caves
description: A collection of cave temples predominantly dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.

name: Valley of Flowers
lootedMessage: The treasure chest is full of... pollen. You start sneezing uncontrollably.

name: Jim Corbett National Park
description: A forested wildlife sanctuary in northern India’s Uttarakhand State.

name: Amer Fort
lootedMessage: A sign says: 'Princess took the treasure for her wedding dowry'. You're too late.

name: Marine Drive, Mumbai
description: A 3.6-kilometre-long Promenade along the Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Road.

name: Andaman Islands
lootedMessage: You found a message in a bottle. It's just a takeout menu.

name: Munnar Tea Gardens
description: A town in the Western Ghats mountain range in India’s Kerala state.

name: Jodhpur, the Blue City
lootedMessage: Everything is blue, including you, because there's no gold to be found.

name: Nahargarh Fort
description: Stands on the edge of the Aravalli Hills, overlooking the city of Jaipur.

name: Rishikesh
lootedMessage: Someone replaced the gold with yoga mats. Not quite the same.

name: Spiti Valley
description: A cold-desert mountain valley located high in the Himalayas in the north-eastern part of the northern Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

name: Golconda Fort
lootedMessage: The fort is in ruins, and so are your dreams of treasure. All gone.

name: Alleppey Backwaters
description: The hub of Kerala's backwaters, home to a vast network of waterways.

name: Gokarna
lootedMessage: The treasure seems to have washed out to sea. Hope you brought your floaties.

name: Hogenakkal Falls
description: A waterfall in South India on the Kaveri river in the Dharmapuri district.

name: Shillong
lootedMessage: The 'Scotland of the East' is beautiful, but the treasure has been repatriated... somewhere.

name: Majuli Island
description: A river island in the Brahmaputra River, Assam and in 2016 it became the first island to be made a district in India.

name: Mahabodhi Temple
lootedMessage: The treasure has reached nirvana and is no longer attached to material wealth.

name: Khajjiar
description: A hill station in Chamba district, Himachal Pradesh, India, located approximately 24 km from Dalhousie.

name: Fatehpur Sikri
lootedMessage: The city was abandoned, and it looks like they took the treasure with them.

name: Golden Fort, Jaisalmer
description: One of the very few 'living forts' in the world, with a quarter of the old city's population residing within its walls.

name: Kumbhalgarh Fort
lootedMessage: The wall is long, your search was long, but your treasure haul is zero.

name: Goa Velha
description: Known for its colonial-era monuments like the Basilica of Bom Jesus, with the remains of St. Francis Xavier.

name: Badami Caves
lootedMessage: You found a carving that looks like a treasure map, but it just leads to the exit.

name: Orchha
description: A town in Niwari district of Madhya Pradesh state, India. The town was established by Rudra Pratap Singh some time after 1501.

name: Gwalior Fort
lootedMessage: A big, impressive, and thoroughly plundered fort. Not a single gem left.

name: Dudhsagar Falls
description: A four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River in the Indian state of Goa.

name: Agra Fort
lootedMessage: So close to the Taj Mahal, yet so far from any treasure.

name: Rock Garden, Chandigarh
description: A sculpture garden for rock enthusiasts in Chandigarh, India.

name: Nohkalikai Falls
lootedMessage: The treasure chest fell into the plunge pool. It's gone forever.

name: Matheran
description: A hill station and a municipal council in the Raigad district in the Indian state of Maharashtra.

name: Athirapally Falls
lootedMessage: The 'Niagara of India' is powerful, but it couldn't protect this empty chest.

name: Cherrapunji
description: A subdivisional town in the East Khasi Hills district in the Indian state of Meghalaya.

name: Jaipur City Palace
lootedMessage: The royal family has excellent taste, and apparently, all the treasure too.

name: Bibi Ka Maqbara
description: A tomb located in Aurangabad, Maharashtra, India. It was commissioned in 1660 by the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb.

name: Nandi Hills
lootedMessage: You climbed all the way up here for this? An empty box and a nice sunrise.

name: Lonavala
description: A hill station town and a municipal council in Pune district in the Indian State of Maharashtra.

name: Chikmagalur
lootedMessage: The aroma of coffee is strong, but the scent of gold is nowhere to be found.

name: Kodaikanal
description: A hill town in the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It’s set in an area of granite cliffs, forested valleys, lakes, waterfalls and grassy hills.

name: Nainital
lootedMessage: You searched around the lake, but all you got were some curious stares from locals.

name: Mussoorie
description: A hill station and a municipal board in the Dehradun district of the Indian state of Uttarakhand.

name: Pahalgam
lootedMessage: The beautiful valley has been picked clean. Not a single rupee left.

name: Gulmarg
description: A town, a hill station, a popular skiing destination and a notified area committee in the Baramulla district.

name: Sonmarg
lootedMessage: The 'Meadow of Gold' is a lie! It's just a meadow of... grass.

name: Auli
description: A Himalayan ski resort and hill station in the north Indian state of Uttarakhand.

name: Manali
lootedMessage: Too many tourists. One of them must have found the treasure and bought a nice sweater with it.

name: Dalhousie
description: A high-altitude town spread across 5 hills near the Dhauladhar mountain range in the north Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

name: Yumthang Valley
lootedMessage: A yeti is using the treasure chest as a lunchbox. You decide to leave it alone.

name: Zanskar Valley
description: A tehsil of the Kargil district, which lies in the Indian union territory of Ladakh.

name: Nubra Valley
lootedMessage: The two-humped camels seem to be laughing at your empty-handedness.

name: Tso Moriri Lake
description: A lake in the Changthang Plateau in northern India.

name: Lakshadweep Islands
lootedMessage: You found the X on the map, but it just marks a great spot for coconut water.

name: Srinagar
description: The largest city and the summer capital of the Indian union territory of Jammu and Kashmir.

name: Ajmer Sharif Dargah
lootedMessage: Your quest for treasure ends here. But your quest for spiritual peace can begin!

name: Vrindavan
description: A historical city in the Mathura district of Uttar Pradesh, India.

name: Mathura
lootedMessage: Lots of temples, but it seems all the treasure was an offering.

name: Bodh Gaya
description: A village in the northeast Indian state of Bihar. Considered one of the most important Buddhist pilgrimage sites.

name: Sarnath
lootedMessage: You found a single coin and a note saying 'Started a monastery, needed funding'.

name: Kushinagar
description: A town in the Kushinagar district of the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.

name: Itimad-ud-Daulah's Tomb
lootedMessage: This 'Baby Taj' has a baby-sized treasure: nothing.

name: Mandu, Madhya Pradesh
description: An ancient city in the present-day Mandav area of the Dhar district.

name: Junagarh Fort
lootedMessage: Guarded by silence and emptiness. No treasure for you.

name: Leh Palace
description: A former royal palace overlooking the town of Leh, Ladakh, in the Indian Himalayas.

name: Shanti Stupa, Leh
lootedMessage: You feel at peace. A peaceful, treasure-less peace.

name: Magnetic Hill
description: A 'gravity hill' located near Leh in Ladakh, India.

name: Dhanushkodi
lootedMessage: The ghost town is also a ghost treasure town. Spooky and empty.

name: Chilika Lake
description: A brackish water lagoon, spread over the Puri, Khurda and Ganjam districts of Odisha.

name: Konkani Coast
lootedMessage: The coast is clear... of any treasure, that is.

name: Mamallapuram Shore Temple
description: It overlooks the shore of the Bay of Bengal. It is a structural temple, built with blocks of granite, dating from the 8th century AD.

name: Kalpeni Island
lootedMessage: You found a beautiful seashell, but the pearl inside was missing.

name: Jallianwala Bagh
description: A historic garden and ‘memorial of national importance’ in Amritsar, India.

name: Sabarmati Ashram
lootedMessage: The only treasure here is simplicity and history. No gold.

name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
description: A Hindu navaratna temple located at Dakshineswar. Situated on the eastern bank of the Hooghly River.
